Package mklab.JGNN.core

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • mklab.JGNN.core.Tensor
      • mklab.JGNN.core.Matrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Long>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColumnRepetition, DenseMatrix, RowRepetition, SparseMatrix, SparseSymmetric
    public abstract class Matrix
extends Tensor
    This class provides an abstract implementation of Matrix functionalities. Matrices inherit Tensor functionalities, such as addition, element-by-element multiplication, randomizing them and producing zero copies.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Krasanakis

      • transposed

        public final Matrix transposed()
        Creates a transposed copy of the matrix. Note: Contrary to typical tensor operations, in-place transposition is not supported. However, matmul(Matrix, boolean, boolean) can be used to transpose matrices before multiplication.
        Returns:
        A transposed copy of the matrix.

      • transform

        public final Tensor transform​(Tensor x)
        Performs the linear algebra transformation A*x where A is this matrix and x a vector
        Parameters:
        x - The one-dimensional tensor which is the vector being transformed.
        Returns:
        The one-dimensional outcome of the transformation.

      • matmul

        public final Matrix matmul​(Matrix with)
        Performs the matrix multiplication of this*with and the recipient.
        Parameters:
        with - The matrix to multiply with.
        Returns:
        A matrix that stores the outcome of the multiplication.
        See Also:
        matmul(Matrix)

      • matmul

        public final Matrix matmul​(Matrix with,
                           boolean transposeSelf,
                           boolean transposeWith)
        Can be used to perform fast computation of the matrix multiplications this*with, this.transposed()*with, this*with.transposed(), this.transposed()*with.transposed while avoiding the overhead of calling transposed(). In this first of those cases, this operation becomes equivalent to matmul(Matrix).
        Parameters:
        with - The matrix to multiply with.
        transposeSelf - Whether this matrix should be transposed before multiplication.
        transposeWith - Whether the multiplied with matrix should be transposed before multiplication.
        Returns:
        A matrix that stores the outcome of the multiplication.
        See Also:
        matmul(Matrix), transposed()
